alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 21 at 6:26PM EDT until July 21 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL PISCATAQUIS COUNTY... At 626 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles north of Elliottsville, or 7 miles east of Greenville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... White Cap Mountain, Frenchtown, Elliottsville, Beaver Cove, and Lily Bay. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A severe thunderstorm has some potential for producing a tornado although forecaster confidence is not high enough to issue a tornado warning. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
